intro: Parietaria rubicunda, commonly known as the red-veined wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lobed and have a distinctive reddish vein pattern. Parietaria rubicunda is often found growing on rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
